Description: Rim sherd (mended from three fragments) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; alternating lotus flowers and rosettes in added white outline with added red centres; below, white and red bands; exterior: at rim, single row of dots between brown lines; reserved below.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by British School at Athens. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The number '9' is written in faint ink on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Smith 2009 / East Greek Pottery in the Collection of the British School at Athens (p. 351, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1201) (phase 2)
